question: The Economic Survey 2017-18 has identified four possible headwinds that are impeding India’s transformation from developing to developed economy. Which of following is not the one among them?
option1: Hyper globalization which reduces India’s exporting opportunities
option2: Difficulties of transferring resources from low productivity to higher productivity sectors
option3: Upgrading human capital as per the demands of a technology-intensive workplace
option4: Towering stress on banks due to large loans to the corporate sector turning into stressed and non-performing assets (NPAs)
answer: Towering stress on banks due to large loans to the corporate sector turning into stressed and non-performing assets (NPAs)
explanation: The Economic Survey 2017-18 notes that India could face a “Late Converger Stall” when it comes to economic growth. The survey identified four major factors impeding India’s growth to developed economy viz. climate change-induced agricultural stress; hyper-globalization which reduces India’s exporting opportunities; difficulties of transferring resources from low productivity to higher productivity sectors; & upgrading human capital as per the demands of a technology-intensive workplace.
